poem:
**January, Alfriston**

The Downs  
too much for one pair of eyes—  
chalk rolls  
to the teetering sea.

A stiff breeze  
lifts the blues.

Red-brick, 14th century  
warm paint on wood,  
block-printed walls.

Croquet on the long lawn—  
then the heated pool  
steaming year-round.

After: fire in the bar,  
Norfolk cauliflower  
slow-roasted,  
and we begin again.
